de_DE.2CdpUR: Money built for you, not banks
de_DE.2C7QC2: Bitcoin Cash makes money work for you. Pay people fast, send money abroad basically for free, and store savings securely—all without middlemen controlling your funds.
de_DE.3bJF4s: Coffee to go? Time for a new laptop? Get it with Bitcoin Cash at an increasing number of participating websites and stores. Simply scan to check out, just like Google Pay.
de_DE.3SfaRA: Send money abroad basically for free
de_DE.29O6Jz: On average, banks take a 6.8% cut out of the money you send home. Bitcoin Cash is much cheaper—and faster, too. Use it to send remittances for less than a cent.
de_DE.3SN5n9: Pay with the privacy of cash
de_DE.2YvhRY: Since a bank account is tied to your identity, your transaction history is, too. Bitcoin Cash is the opposite: nobody knows who you are and payments can be sent privately.
de_DE.3m6uDG: Pay online without a bank account
de_DE.20ncQp: Too far away? Too many fees? Whatever your reason for not owning a bank account, Bitcoin Cash can help. Use it to pay and get paid online without the need for banks.
de_DE.1m65gv: Splitting the bill? Send money to your friend's wallet or have them send it to yours instead. Payments are fast and go directly between the two of you—no banks needed.
de_DE.31jsRz: Store savings in a safer place
de_DE.3fvel5: Scammers can pretend to be your bank, using scare tactics to trick you into sending them money. Bitcoin Cash fixes this trust issue by removing third parties altogether.
de_DE.2LV9oT: Bitcoin Cash does what banks can't do
de_DE.3bZEuY: Payments go directly from one person to another.
de_DE.1cqDVr: No matter how much you send, fees are always tiny.
de_DE.wcVx5: Money is sent and received fast—no delays, no limits.
de_DE.2odNPk: And everyone, everywhere can use it
de_DE.1c7j6u: Bitcoin Cash is sound money for the world. To meet growing demand, developers are always scaling the Bitcoin Cash network.
de_DE.1ApaRv: Easy ways to buy Bitcoin Cash
de_DE.30ofiL: Subscribe for Bitcoin Cash news, guides, and more.
de_DE.92paN: secure within 3 seconds - transaction fees forever low
de_DE.2nX03h: all classes of assets traded on the blockchain
de_DE.NzxX0: The goal for Bitcoin Cash is to become sound money that is usable by everyone in the world. This is a civilization-changing technology which will dramatically increase human freedom and prosperity.
de_DE.2xz1tO: This roadmap is intended to provide high-level technical direction, and enable different technical teams to work together towards a common goal for advancing Bitcoin Cash. The role of developers in furth ering this goal is to produce high-quality professional software that serves the needs of its users, miners and merchants. We strive for continuous technical improvement, to produce reliable products providing a solid foundation for Bitcoin Cash.
de_DE.2u3To0: The basic design of Bitcoin Cash is sound. However, this does not mean it is perfect. It is prudent to make incremental improvements to the system with technically sound design and careful engineering. By implementing optimizations and protocol upgrades, peer-to-peer digital cash will scale many orders of magnitude beyond current limits.
de_DE.30Hzlu: The needed technical improvements can be divided into three categories:
de_DE.WN3iT: Enable Bitcoin Cash to scale from ~100 Tx/s to over 5,000,000 Tx/s. Protocol improvements must be made so that mass-parallelization can enable this level of transaction processing.
de_DE.3svlWD: Improving the payment experience to ensure that it is instant and reliable. Transactions should be secure within three seconds.
de_DE.q69ZY: Make Bitcoin Cash extensible. An extensible protocol makes future improvements less disruptive, and provides a solid base for businesses and developers to build on.
de_DE.1YkBQG: The Bitcoin Cash network has protocol upgrades twice a year, on November 15th and May 15th. These upgrades are required for all node operators. They are sometimes referred to as "hard fork upgrades", but the term "scheduled protocol upgrades" is preferred.
de_DE.mdJVL: Rather than a specific block height, the upgrades are based on a timestamp. When the median timestamp of the most recent 11 blocks (MTP-11) is greater than or equal to UNIX timestamp of November 15th (or May 15th) 12:00:00 UTC, the new protocol rules take effect. This better enables your business to prepare for the upgrade at a particular estimated time, plus or minus a few hours.
de_DE.1vCcB6: Although this semi-annual upgrade schedule is not expected to continue forever, it is in place for the forseeable near-term future. Regular protocol upgrades provide a predictable cadence for the ecosystem, and are necessary to achieve the vision set forth in the roadmap.
de_DE.3m1Olg: To become a solid base for application development and innovation, Bitcoin Cash must continuously improve and compete. Working together, we can build a technical foundation to empower Bitcoin Cash to be the best money the world has ever seen.

en_US.2CdpUR: Money built for you, not banks
en_US.2C7QC2: Bitcoin Cash makes money work for you. Pay people fast, send money abroad basically for free, and store savings securely—all without middlemen controlling your funds.
en_US.3bJF4s: Coffee to go? Time for a new laptop? Get it with Bitcoin Cash at an increasing number of participating websites and stores. Simply scan to check out, just like Google Pay.
en_US.3SfaRA: Send money abroad basically for free
en_US.29O6Jz: On average, banks take a 6.8% cut out of the money you send home. Bitcoin Cash is much cheaper—and faster, too. Use it to send remittances for less than a cent.
en_US.3SN5n9: Pay with the privacy of cash
en_US.2YvhRY: Since a bank account is tied to your identity, your transaction history is, too. Bitcoin Cash is the opposite: nobody knows who you are and payments can be sent privately.
en_US.3m6uDG: Pay online without a bank account
en_US.20ncQp: Too far away? Too many fees? Whatever your reason for not owning a bank account, Bitcoin Cash can help. Use it to pay and get paid online without the need for banks.
en_US.1m65gv: Splitting the bill? Send money to your friend's wallet or have them send it to yours instead. Payments are fast and go directly between the two of you—no banks needed.
en_US.31jsRz: Store savings in a safer place
en_US.3fvel5: Scammers can pretend to be your bank, using scare tactics to trick you into sending them money. Bitcoin Cash fixes this trust issue by removing third parties altogether.
en_US.2LV9oT: Bitcoin Cash does what banks can't do
en_US.3bZEuY: Payments go directly from one person to another.
en_US.1cqDVr: No matter how much you send, fees are always tiny.
en_US.wcVx5: Money is sent and received fast—no delays, no limits.
en_US.2odNPk: And everyone, everywhere can use it
en_US.1c7j6u: Bitcoin Cash is sound money for the world. To meet growing demand, developers are always scaling the Bitcoin Cash network.
en_US.1ApaRv: Easy ways to buy Bitcoin Cash
en_US.30ofiL: Subscribe for Bitcoin Cash news, guides, and more.
en_US.92paN: secure within 3 seconds - transaction fees forever low
en_US.2nX03h: all classes of assets traded on the blockchain
en_US.NzxX0: The goal for Bitcoin Cash is to become sound money that is usable by everyone in the world. This is a civilization-changing technology which will dramatically increase human freedom and prosperity.
en_US.2xz1tO: This roadmap is intended to provide high-level technical direction, and enable different technical teams to work together towards a common goal for advancing Bitcoin Cash. The role of developers in furth ering this goal is to produce high-quality professional software that serves the needs of its users, miners and merchants. We strive for continuous technical improvement, to produce reliable products providing a solid foundation for Bitcoin Cash.
en_US.2u3To0: The basic design of Bitcoin Cash is sound. However, this does not mean it is perfect. It is prudent to make incremental improvements to the system with technically sound design and careful engineering. By implementing optimizations and protocol upgrades, peer-to-peer digital cash will scale many orders of magnitude beyond current limits.
en_US.30Hzlu: The needed technical improvements can be divided into three categories:
en_US.WN3iT: Enable Bitcoin Cash to scale from ~100 Tx/s to over 5,000,000 Tx/s. Protocol improvements must be made so that mass-parallelization can enable this level of transaction processing.
en_US.3svlWD: Improving the payment experience to ensure that it is instant and reliable. Transactions should be secure within three seconds.
en_US.q69ZY: Make Bitcoin Cash extensible. An extensible protocol makes future improvements less disruptive, and provides a solid base for businesses and developers to build on.
en_US.1YkBQG: The Bitcoin Cash network has protocol upgrades twice a year, on November 15th and May 15th. These upgrades are required for all node operators. They are sometimes referred to as "hard fork upgrades", but the term "scheduled protocol upgrades" is preferred.
en_US.mdJVL: Rather than a specific block height, the upgrades are based on a timestamp. When the median timestamp of the most recent 11 blocks (MTP-11) is greater than or equal to UNIX timestamp of November 15th (or May 15th) 12:00:00 UTC, the new protocol rules take effect. This better enables your business to prepare for the upgrade at a particular estimated time, plus or minus a few hours.
en_US.1vCcB6: Although this semi-annual upgrade schedule is not expected to continue forever, it is in place for the forseeable near-term future. Regular protocol upgrades provide a predictable cadence for the ecosystem, and are necessary to achieve the vision set forth in the roadmap.
en_US.3m1Olg: To become a solid base for application development and innovation, Bitcoin Cash must continuously improve and compete. Working together, we can build a technical foundation to empower Bitcoin Cash to be the best money the world has ever seen.

ja_JP.3m6uDG: Pay online without a bank account
ja_JP.20ncQp: Too far away? Too many fees? Whatever your reason for not owning a bank account, Bitcoin Cash can help. Use it to pay and get paid online without the need for banks.
ja_JP.1m65gv: Splitting the bill? Send money to your friend's wallet or have them send it to yours instead. Payments are fast and go directly between the two of you—no banks needed.
ja_JP.31jsRz: Store savings in a safer place
ja_JP.3fvel5: Scammers can pretend to be your bank, using scare tactics to trick you into sending them money. Bitcoin Cash fixes this trust issue by removing third parties altogether.
ja_JP.2LV9oT: Bitcoin Cash does what banks can't do
ja_JP.3bZEuY: Payments go directly from one person to another.
ja_JP.1cqDVr: No matter how much you send, fees are always tiny.
ja_JP.wcVx5: Money is sent and received fast—no delays, no limits.
ja_JP.2odNPk: And everyone, everywhere can use it
ja_JP.1c7j6u: Bitcoin Cash is sound money for the world. To meet growing demand, developers are always scaling the Bitcoin Cash network.
ja_JP.1ApaRv: Easy ways to buy Bitcoin Cash
ja_JP.30ofiL: Subscribe for Bitcoin Cash news, guides, and more.
ja_JP.92paN: secure within 3 seconds - transaction fees forever low
ja_JP.2nX03h: all classes of assets traded on the blockchain
ja_JP.NzxX0: The goal for Bitcoin Cash is to become sound money that is usable by everyone in the world. This is a civilization-changing technology which will dramatically increase human freedom and prosperity.
ja_JP.2xz1tO: This roadmap is intended to provide high-level technical direction, and enable different technical teams to work together towards a common goal for advancing Bitcoin Cash. The role of developers in furth ering this goal is to produce high-quality professional software that serves the needs of its users, miners and merchants. We strive for continuous technical improvement, to produce reliable products providing a solid foundation for Bitcoin Cash.
ja_JP.2u3To0: The basic design of Bitcoin Cash is sound. However, this does not mean it is perfect. It is prudent to make incremental improvements to the system with technically sound design and careful engineering. By implementing optimizations and protocol upgrades, peer-to-peer digital cash will scale many orders of magnitude beyond current limits.
ja_JP.30Hzlu: The needed technical improvements can be divided into three categories:
ja_JP.WN3iT: Enable Bitcoin Cash to scale from ~100 Tx/s to over 5,000,000 Tx/s. Protocol improvements must be made so that mass-parallelization can enable this level of transaction processing.
ja_JP.3svlWD: Improving the payment experience to ensure that it is instant and reliable. Transactions should be secure within three seconds.
ja_JP.q69ZY: Make Bitcoin Cash extensible. An extensible protocol makes future improvements less disruptive, and provides a solid base for businesses and developers to build on.
ja_JP.1YkBQG: The Bitcoin Cash network has protocol upgrades twice a year, on November 15th and May 15th. These upgrades are required for all node operators. They are sometimes referred to as "hard fork upgrades", but the term "scheduled protocol upgrades" is preferred.
ja_JP.mdJVL: Rather than a specific block height, the upgrades are based on a timestamp. When the median timestamp of the most recent 11 blocks (MTP-11) is greater than or equal to UNIX timestamp of November 15th (or May 15th) 12:00:00 UTC, the new protocol rules take effect. This better enables your business to prepare for the upgrade at a particular estimated time, plus or minus a few hours.
ja_JP.1vCcB6: Although this semi-annual upgrade schedule is not expected to continue forever, it is in place for the forseeable near-term future. Regular protocol upgrades provide a predictable cadence for the ecosystem, and are necessary to achieve the vision set forth in the roadmap.
ja_JP.3m1Olg: To become a solid base for application development and innovation, Bitcoin Cash must continuously improve and compete. Working together, we can build a technical foundation to empower Bitcoin Cash to be the best money the world has ever seen.

ko_KR.2CdpUR: Money built for you, not banks
ko_KR.2C7QC2: Bitcoin Cash makes money work for you. Pay people fast, send money abroad basically for free, and store savings securely—all without middlemen controlling your funds.
ko_KR.3bJF4s: Coffee to go? Time for a new laptop? Get it with Bitcoin Cash at an increasing number of participating websites and stores. Simply scan to check out, just like Google Pay.
ko_KR.3SfaRA: Send money abroad basically for free
ko_KR.29O6Jz: On average, banks take a 6.8% cut out of the money you send home. Bitcoin Cash is much cheaper—and faster, too. Use it to send remittances for less than a cent.
ko_KR.3SN5n9: Pay with the privacy of cash
ko_KR.2YvhRY: Since a bank account is tied to your identity, your transaction history is, too. Bitcoin Cash is the opposite: nobody knows who you are and payments can be sent privately.
ko_KR.3m6uDG: Pay online without a bank account
ko_KR.20ncQp: Too far away? Too many fees? Whatever your reason for not owning a bank account, Bitcoin Cash can help. Use it to pay and get paid online without the need for banks.
ko_KR.1m65gv: Splitting the bill? Send money to your friend's wallet or have them send it to yours instead. Payments are fast and go directly between the two of you—no banks needed.
ko_KR.31jsRz: Store savings in a safer place
ko_KR.3fvel5: Scammers can pretend to be your bank, using scare tactics to trick you into sending them money. Bitcoin Cash fixes this trust issue by removing third parties altogether.
ko_KR.2LV9oT: Bitcoin Cash does what banks can't do
ko_KR.3bZEuY: Payments go directly from one person to another.
ko_KR.1cqDVr: No matter how much you send, fees are always tiny.
ko_KR.wcVx5: Money is sent and received fast—no delays, no limits.
ko_KR.2odNPk: And everyone, everywhere can use it
ko_KR.1c7j6u: Bitcoin Cash is sound money for the world. To meet growing demand, developers are always scaling the Bitcoin Cash network.
ko_KR.1ApaRv: Easy ways to buy Bitcoin Cash
ko_KR.30ofiL: Subscribe for Bitcoin Cash news, guides, and more.
ko_KR.92paN: secure within 3 seconds - transaction fees forever low
ko_KR.2nX03h: all classes of assets traded on the blockchain
ko_KR.NzxX0: The goal for Bitcoin Cash is to become sound money that is usable by everyone in the world. This is a civilization-changing technology which will dramatically increase human freedom and prosperity.
ko_KR.2xz1tO: This roadmap is intended to provide high-level technical direction, and enable different technical teams to work together towards a common goal for advancing Bitcoin Cash. The role of developers in furth ering this goal is to produce high-quality professional software that serves the needs of its users, miners and merchants. We strive for continuous technical improvement, to produce reliable products providing a solid foundation for Bitcoin Cash.
ko_KR.2u3To0: The basic design of Bitcoin Cash is sound. However, this does not mean it is perfect. It is prudent to make incremental improvements to the system with technically sound design and careful engineering. By implementing optimizations and protocol upgrades, peer-to-peer digital cash will scale many orders of magnitude beyond current limits.
ko_KR.30Hzlu: The needed technical improvements can be divided into three categories:
ko_KR.WN3iT: Enable Bitcoin Cash to scale from ~100 Tx/s to over 5,000,000 Tx/s. Protocol improvements must be made so that mass-parallelization can enable this level of transaction processing.
ko_KR.3svlWD: Improving the payment experience to ensure that it is instant and reliable. Transactions should be secure within three seconds.
ko_KR.q69ZY: Make Bitcoin Cash extensible. An extensible protocol makes future improvements less disruptive, and provides a solid base for businesses and developers to build on.
ko_KR.1YkBQG: The Bitcoin Cash network has protocol upgrades twice a year, on November 15th and May 15th. These upgrades are required for all node operators. They are sometimes referred to as "hard fork upgrades", but the term "scheduled protocol upgrades" is preferred.
ko_KR.mdJVL: Rather than a specific block height, the upgrades are based on a timestamp. When the median timestamp of the most recent 11 blocks (MTP-11) is greater than or equal to UNIX timestamp of November 15th (or May 15th) 12:00:00 UTC, the new protocol rules take effect. This better enables your business to prepare for the upgrade at a particular estimated time, plus or minus a few hours.
ko_KR.1vCcB6: Although this semi-annual upgrade schedule is not expected to continue forever, it is in place for the forseeable near-term future. Regular protocol upgrades provide a predictable cadence for the ecosystem, and are necessary to achieve the vision set forth in the roadmap.
ko_KR.3m1Olg: To become a solid base for application development and innovation, Bitcoin Cash must continuously improve and compete. Working together, we can build a technical foundation to empower Bitcoin Cash to be the best money the world has ever seen.

zh_CN.92paN: secure within 3 seconds - transaction fees forever low
zh_CN.2nX03h: all classes of assets traded on the blockchain
zh_CN.NzxX0: The goal for Bitcoin Cash is to become sound money that is usable by everyone in the world. This is a civilization-changing technology which will dramatically increase human freedom and prosperity.
zh_CN.2xz1tO: This roadmap is intended to provide high-level technical direction, and enable different technical teams to work together towards a common goal for advancing Bitcoin Cash. The role of developers in furth ering this goal is to produce high-quality professional software that serves the needs of its users, miners and merchants. We strive for continuous technical improvement, to produce reliable products providing a solid foundation for Bitcoin Cash.
zh_CN.2u3To0: The basic design of Bitcoin Cash is sound. However, this does not mean it is perfect. It is prudent to make incremental improvements to the system with technically sound design and careful engineering. By implementing optimizations and protocol upgrades, peer-to-peer digital cash will scale many orders of magnitude beyond current limits.
zh_CN.30Hzlu: The needed technical improvements can be divided into three categories:
zh_CN.WN3iT: Enable Bitcoin Cash to scale from ~100 Tx/s to over 5,000,000 Tx/s. Protocol improvements must be made so that mass-parallelization can enable this level of transaction processing.
zh_CN.3svlWD: Improving the payment experience to ensure that it is instant and reliable. Transactions should be secure within three seconds.
zh_CN.q69ZY: Make Bitcoin Cash extensible. An extensible protocol makes future improvements less disruptive, and provides a solid base for businesses and developers to build on.
zh_CN.1YkBQG: The Bitcoin Cash network has protocol upgrades twice a year, on November 15th and May 15th. These upgrades are required for all node operators. They are sometimes referred to as "hard fork upgrades", but the term "scheduled protocol upgrades" is preferred.
zh_CN.mdJVL: Rather than a specific block height, the upgrades are based on a timestamp. When the median timestamp of the most recent 11 blocks (MTP-11) is greater than or equal to UNIX timestamp of November 15th (or May 15th) 12:00:00 UTC, the new protocol rules take effect. This better enables your business to prepare for the upgrade at a particular estimated time, plus or minus a few hours.
zh_CN.1vCcB6: Although this semi-annual upgrade schedule is not expected to continue forever, it is in place for the forseeable near-term future. Regular protocol upgrades provide a predictable cadence for the ecosystem, and are necessary to achieve the vision set forth in the roadmap.
zh_CN.3m1Olg: To become a solid base for application development and innovation, Bitcoin Cash must continuously improve and compete. Working together, we can build a technical foundation to empower Bitcoin Cash to be the best money the world has ever seen.

zh_TW.2CdpUR: Money built for you, not banks
zh_TW.2C7QC2: Bitcoin Cash makes money work for you. Pay people fast, send money abroad basically for free, and store savings securely—all without middlemen controlling your funds.
zh_TW.3bJF4s: Coffee to go? Time for a new laptop? Get it with Bitcoin Cash at an increasing number of participating websites and stores. Simply scan to check out, just like Google Pay.
zh_TW.3SfaRA: Send money abroad basically for free
zh_TW.29O6Jz: On average, banks take a 6.8% cut out of the money you send home. Bitcoin Cash is much cheaper—and faster, too. Use it to send remittances for less than a cent.
zh_TW.3SN5n9: Pay with the privacy of cash
zh_TW.2YvhRY: Since a bank account is tied to your identity, your transaction history is, too. Bitcoin Cash is the opposite: nobody knows who you are and payments can be sent privately.
zh_TW.3m6uDG: Pay online without a bank account
zh_TW.20ncQp: Too far away? Too many fees? Whatever your reason for not owning a bank account, Bitcoin Cash can help. Use it to pay and get paid online without the need for banks.
zh_TW.1m65gv: Splitting the bill? Send money to your friend's wallet or have them send it to yours instead. Payments are fast and go directly between the two of you—no banks needed.
zh_TW.31jsRz: Store savings in a safer place
zh_TW.3fvel5: Scammers can pretend to be your bank, using scare tactics to trick you into sending them money. Bitcoin Cash fixes this trust issue by removing third parties altogether.
zh_TW.2LV9oT: Bitcoin Cash does what banks can't do
zh_TW.3bZEuY: Payments go directly from one person to another.
zh_TW.1cqDVr: No matter how much you send, fees are always tiny.
zh_TW.wcVx5: Money is sent and received fast—no delays, no limits.
zh_TW.2odNPk: And everyone, everywhere can use it
zh_TW.1c7j6u: Bitcoin Cash is sound money for the world. To meet growing demand, developers are always scaling the Bitcoin Cash network.
